page.title: 13Housing in Lorton
page.content: The majority of housing in the Lorton area tends to be owner occupied, with a few rented houses, second homes and holiday cottages. There are no housing estates. The building of houses is strictly controlled by the Lake District Special Planning Board. Both outline and detailed planning permission is needed and must conform to the Boards stringent requirements. One such being, that slate is used as a roofing material. There is no apparent need for local authority housing in the Lorton area. Any new homes are built by small contractors for private owners. A small number of barns have been converted to homes also. Many applications to build houses are refused and the few allowed are within the limits of the village or agricultural dwellings on outlying farms.
